p: Dengue epidemics in the previous 15 years were used as a proxy of the herd immunity level among women of reproductive age. The choice of the threshold that we considered high enough to either protect or increase microcephaly risk (of 400/100,000 inhabitants) was data-driven, based on the best fit. The threshold of 300 cases/100,000 inhabitants as high incidence areas, as defined by the Brazilian Ministry of Health, is a number defined ad hoc, not sustained by any scientific argument in any guideline of the dengue control program published since 2002.
